page.title: 08TRANSPORT
page.content: The bus service which calls to the village on its journey from Maidstone to Folkestone is not very regular and most people in the area have to rely on a motor car or else use the train. The station is just 5 minutes walk from the western edge of the D-block and is on the main line from Ashford to London Victoria. Most people in the village do their shopping in Maidstone or Sittingbourne and a lot of people commute to London each day to work, a journey of approximately 80 minutes on the train. Children who live up on the Downs are brought to school each day by mini-bus and the older children attending Swadelands School in Lenham travel by coach which picks them up outside the primary school each day.
